snippet: More than a half-dozen Sioux tribes are trying to come up with the $9 million purchase price for Pe’ Sla, a sacred parcel of land seized long ago by the federal government in violation of treaties.
abstract: More than a half-dozen Sioux tribes are trying to raise $9 million to purchase a land parcel in the South Dakota mountains called Pe' Sla, seized long ago by the federal government in violation of treaties; bid was accepted by the family that had controlled the land since 1876, but tribes must come up with the purchase price before a looming deadline.
lead_paragraph: More than a half-dozen Sioux tribes are trying to come up with the $9 million purchase price for Pe’ Sla, a sacred parcel of land seized long ago by the federal government in violation of treaties.
